intro: Physalastrum, commonly known as the Indian madder, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or herbs native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. The plants are characterized by their upright growth habit, hairy stems, and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Physalastrum species are often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
